turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about History of Brittany.
turn.1: What are the main aspects of Brittany's history?
turn.2: These Britons gave the region its current name and contributed the Breton language, "Brezhoneg", a sister language to Welsh and Cornish.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: (Brittany used to be known in English as "Little Britain" to distinguish it from Great Britain – the street in London called "Little Britain " was the location of the embassy of the Duchy of Brittany).
turn.5: Who was the leader of the Britons?
turn.6: Conan Meriadoc, the mythic founder of the house of Rohan, is mentioned by medieval Welsh sources as having led the settlement of Brittany by mercenaries serving Maximus.
turn.7: What happened to the original inhabitants?
turn.8: The Welsh text "The Dream of Maxen", which contains semi-factual information about the usurpation of Maximus, states that they married native women after cutting out their tongues to preserve the purity of their language.
turn.10: This can be interpreted as a legend formulated in order to explain the Welsh (Brythonic) name for Brittany, "Llydaw", as originating from "lled-taw" or "half-silent".
turn.11: What did the Britons do to preserve the language?
turn.12: In fact, the term "Llydaw" or "Ledav" in early Breton probably derives from the Celtic name Litavis.
